intro: Dicranostyles villosa var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy dicranostyle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
